_meanings:
({%a%}) To enter into, be settled in; to
occupy, set foot in. ({%b%}) To take 
possession of, resort to, be attached to
(with <ab>acc.</ab>); {#aBiniviSate sanmArgaM#} <ls>Sk.</ls>
takes to, follows, a good path; {#sEvaM#}
{#DanyA gaRikAdArikA yAmevaM#} 
{#Bavanmano'BiniviSate#} <ls>Dk. 57</ls>, <ls>Mu. 5. 12</ls>,  
<ls>Bk. 8. 80.</ls>

To make one enter or
occupy, lead, carry or conduct to; (<ab>fig.</ab>)
apply, direct or turn (as mind, heart
&c.) towards something;  
{#pratibaMDavatsvapi vizayezu aBiniveSya#} <ls>M. 3</ls>, <ls>Åši. 1. 15</ls>
